intro: Strychnos gomesiana, commonly known as the Gomesia starfruit, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a distinctive fruit structure. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
